page.title: 01General Summary of Area
page.content: Morecambe is situated on the North West coast at the southern edge of the Lake District. It is sheltered to the east and north by mountains which gives it a distinctly local climate. Its winters are relatively mild and very wet. Historically it has grown from the villages of Bare, Torrisholme and Poulton and recently become part of Lancaster City Council. Lancaster bounds the area to the east. Lancaster was a thriving industrial town but this has declined and tourism now plays a large part in the life of the area as a whole. Morecambe is famous for its shrimps caught and potted locally. People born and bred in the town are known as 'Sand Grown Uns' as was Eric Morecambe. It is renowned for its beautiful sunsets and panoramic views.
